|rad1chip2 = Broadcom;BCM2050; |rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = U.FL |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4 |rad1correv = |rad1cap = }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== Manuf. by Foxconn / Hon Hai / Ambit, model U12H042 The power adapter included with the device may be a '''Netgear''' 330-10129-01 (12V, 1A). ID/OD/Len measurements are approximate. ==Links of Interest== [https://forum.openwrt.org/viewtopic.php?pid=13540 A mention on the OpenWrt forums]
[http://web.archive.org/web/20061028034050/http://www.tahoma.com/~wrtinfo/netgearwgt614v6.jpg A somewhat high-res internal shot at tahoma.com/~wrtinfo (via archive.org)] [http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=W1wHW5bJZgo ''Netgear WGR614 Repair - Bad Capacitors'' on YouTube] *[http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=44439 Netgear WGR614v6 running dd-wrt.v24_micro successfully!] On the '''DD-WRT''' Forum, some had 2MB flash ==Pictures==
